00020 #include <stdio.h>
00021 #include <stdlib.h>
00022 #include <errno.h>

00025 #include <sqlite3.h>

00027 
00028 int evaluate_stmt(sqlite3_stmt *pp_stmt,
00029                   struct Entry *p_entry)
00030 {
00031         int num_column;
00032         int count;
00033         char *col_name;
00034         char *col_value;
00035         int tmp_priority = 0;
00036         int tmp_country_code = 0;
00037         int tmp_area_code = 0;
00038         unsigned long long tmp_number = 0;
00039 
00040         num_column = sqlite3_column_count(pp_stmt);
00041         col_name = sqlite3_malloc(2 * num_column * sizeof(const char *) + 1);
00042 
00043         for ( count = 0; count < num_column; count++ ) {
00044                 col_name = (char *)sqlite3_column_name(pp_stmt, count);
00045                 col_value = (char *)sqlite3_column_text(pp_stmt, count);
00046                 if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_PRIORITY) ) {
00047                         tmp_priority = atoi(col_value);
00048                 } else if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_COUNTRYCODE) ) {
00049                         tmp_country_code = atoi(col_value);
00050                 } else if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_AREACODE) ) {
00051                         tmp_area_code = atoi(col_value);
00052                 } else if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_NUMBER) ) {
00053                         tmp_number = atoll(col_value);
00054                 }
00055         }
00056 
00057         if ( PRIO_ALL == tmp_priority ) {
00058                 if ( tmp_country_code == (p_entry->country_code)
00059                                 && tmp_area_code == (p_entry->area_code)
00060                                 && tmp_number == (p_entry->number) ) {
00061                         return 1;
00062                 }
00063         } else if ( tmp_priority <= (p_entry->priority) ) {
00064                 if ( tmp_country_code == (p_entry->country_code)
00065                                 && tmp_area_code == (p_entry->area_code)
00066                                 && tmp_number == (p_entry->number) ) {
00067                         return 1;
00068                 }
00069         }
00070 
00071         return 0;
00072 }
00073 
00074 int evaluate_stmt_string(sqlite3_stmt *pp_stmt,
00075                          char *number,
00076                          int priority)
00077 {
00078         int num_column;
00079         int count;
00080         char *col_name;
00081         char *col_value;
00082         int tmp_priority = 0;
00083         char tmp_number[32] = "";
00084 
00085         num_column = sqlite3_column_count(pp_stmt);
00086         col_name = sqlite3_malloc(2 * num_column * sizeof(const char *) + 1);
00087 
00088         for ( count = 0; count < num_column; count++ ) {
00089                  col_name = (char *)sqlite3_column_name(pp_stmt, count);
00090                  col_value = (char *)sqlite3_column_text(pp_stmt, count);
00091                  if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_PRIORITY) ) {
00092                          tmp_priority = atoi(col_value);
00093                  } else if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_COUNTRYCODE) ) {
00094                          strcat(tmp_number, col_value);
00095                  } else if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_AREACODE) ) {
00096                          strcat(tmp_number, col_value);
00097                  } else if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_NUMBER) ) {
00098                          strcat(tmp_number, col_value);
00099                  }
00100         }
00101 
00102         if ( PRIO_ALL == tmp_priority ) {
00103                 if ( 0 == strcmp(tmp_number, number) ) return 1;
00104         } else if ( tmp_priority <= priority ) {
00105                 if ( 0 == strcmp(tmp_number, number) ) return 1;
00106         }
00107 
00108         return 0;
00109 }
00110 
00111 int add_entry(int country_code,
00112               int area_code,
00113               unsigned long long number,
00114               char *name,
00115               char *reason,
00116               int priority,
00117               int listflag)
00118 {
00119         if ( priority < PRIO_ALL
00120                         || 0 == country_code
00121                         || 0 == area_code
00122                         || 0 == number ) return -1;
00123 
00124         char *listname = (WHITELIST_FLAG == listflag) ? "whitelist" : "blacklist";
00125 
00126         sqlite3 *db;
00127         char *errMsg = 0;
00128         char stmt[STMT_SIZE];
00129         int rc;
00130 
00131         rc = sqlite3_open(DB_FILE, &db);
00132 
00133         if ( rc ) {
00134                 syslog(LOG_ERR, "[%s] Can't open database: %s", COMPONENT_NAME, sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00135                 sqlite3_close(db);
00136                 return -1;
00137         }
00138 
00139         sprintf(stmt, "INSERT INTO %s (%s, %s, %s, %s, %s, %s) VALUES(%d, %d, %d, %lld, \"%s\", \"%s\")", listname, TB_PRIORITY, TB_COUNTRYCODE, TB_AREACODE, TB_NUMBER, TB_NAME, TB_REASON, priority, country_code, area_code, number, name, reason);
00140 
00141         rc = sqlite3_exec(db, stmt, NULL, 0, &errMsg);
00142         if ( SQLITE_OK != rc ) {
00143                 syslog(LOG_ERR, "[%s] SQL error: %s", COMPONENT_NAME, sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00144                 sqlite3_close(db);
00145                 return -1;
00146         }
00147 
00148         sqlite3_close(db);
00149 
00150         return 0;
00151 }

00153 int rm_entry (int country_code,
00154               int area_code,
00155               unsigned long long number,
00156               int listflag)
00157 {
00158         char *listname = (WHITELIST_FLAG == listflag) ? "whitelist" : "blacklist";
00159 
00160         sqlite3 *db;
00161         char *errMsg = 0;
00162         char stmt[STMT_SIZE];
00163         int rc;
00164 
00165         rc = sqlite3_open(DB_FILE, &db);
00166 
00167         if ( rc ) {
00168                 syslog(LOG_ERR, "[%s] Cant't open database: %s", COMPONENT_NAME, sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00169                 sqlite3_close(db);
00170                 return -1;
00171         }
00172 
00173         sprintf(stmt, "DELETE FROM %s WHERE %s = %d AND %s = %d AND %s = %lld", listname, TB_COUNTRYCODE, country_code, TB_AREACODE, area_code, TB_NUMBER, number);
00174 
00175         rc = sqlite3_exec(db, stmt, NULL, 0, &errMsg);
00176         if ( SQLITE_OK != rc ) {
00177                 syslog(LOG_ERR, "[%s] SQL error: %s", COMPONENT_NAME, sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00178                 sqlite3_close(db);
00179                 return -1;
00180         }
00181 
00182         sqlite3_close(db);
00183         return 0;
00184 }
00185 
00186 int check_entry(int country_code,
00187                 int area_code,
00188                 unsigned long long number,
00189                 int priority,
00190                 int listflag)
00191 {
00192         char *listname = (WHITELIST_FLAG == listflag) ? "whitelist" : "blacklist";
00193 
00194         sqlite3 *db;
00195         char stmt[STMT_SIZE];       // The SQL statement as text string.
00196         sqlite3_stmt *pp_stmt = 0;  // The prepared statement
00197         const char **p_tail = 0;    // The unused part of stmt
00198         int rc;
00199         int found_flag = 0;
00200 
00201         struct Entry *p_entry = (struct Entry *) malloc(sizeof(struct Entry));
00202         p_entry->country_code = country_code;
00203         p_entry->area_code = area_code;
00204         p_entry->number = number;
00205         p_entry->priority = priority;
00206 
00207         rc = sqlite3_open(DB_FILE, &db);
00208 
00209         if ( rc ) {
00210                 syslog(LOG_ERR, "[%s] Can't open database: %s", COMPONENT_NAME, sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00211                 sqlite3_close(db);
00212                 return -1;
00213         }
00214 
00215         sprintf(stmt, "SELECT %1$s, %2$s, %3$s, %4$s FROM %5$s ORDER BY %1$s, %2$s, %3$s, %4$s", TB_PRIORITY, TB_COUNTRYCODE, TB_AREACODE, TB_NUMBER, listname);
00216 
00217         rc = sqlite3_prepare_v2(db, stmt, sizeof(stmt), &pp_stmt, p_tail);
00218 
00219         if ( rc != SQLITE_OK ) {
00220                 syslog(LOG_ERR, "[%s] SQL error: %s", COMPONENT_NAME, sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00221                 sqlite3_close(db);
00222                 return -1;
00223         }
00224 
00225         while ( rc != SQLITE_DONE ) {
00226                 rc = sqlite3_step(pp_stmt);
00227                 if ( SQLITE_ROW == rc ) {
00228                         found_flag = evaluate_stmt(pp_stmt, p_entry);
00229                         if ( found_flag == 1) {
00230                                 switch (listflag) {
00231                                         case WHITELIST_FLAG:
00232                                                 syslog(LOG_DEBUG, "[%s] Number \"+%d %d %llu\" accepted successfully.", COMPONENT_NAME, country_code, area_code, number);
00233                                                 break;
00234                                         case BLACKLIST_FLAG:
00235                                                 syslog(LOG_DEBUG, "[%s] Number \"+%d %d %llu\" blocked successfully.", COMPONENT_NAME, country_code, area_code, number);
00236                                                 break;
00237                                         default:
00238                                                 syslog(LOG_CRIT, "[%s] Stuff is no blacklist nor a whitelist.", COMPONENT_NAME);
00239                                 }
00240                                 break;
00241                         }
00242                 }
00243         }
00244 
00245 
00246         // Cleaning up
00247         sqlite3_finalize(pp_stmt);
00248         sqlite3_close(db);
00249         free(p_entry);
00250 
00251         return found_flag;
00252 }
00253 
00254 int check_entry_string(char *number,
00255                        int priority,
00256                        int listflag)
00257 {
00258         char *listname = (WHITELIST_FLAG == listflag) ? "whitelist" : "blacklist";
00259 
00260         sqlite3 *db;
00261         char stmt[STMT_SIZE];       // The SQL statement as text string.
00262         sqlite3_stmt *pp_stmt = 0;  // The prepared statement
00263         const char **p_tail = 0;    // The unused part of stmt
00264         int rc;
00265         int found_flag = 0;
00266 
00267         rc = sqlite3_open(DB_FILE, &db);
00268 
00269         if ( rc ) {
00270                 syslog(LOG_ERR, "[%s] Can't open database: %s", COMPONENT_NAME, sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00271                 sqlite3_close(db);
00272                 return -1;
00273         }
00274 
00275         sprintf(stmt, "SELECT %1$s, %2$s, %3$s, %4$s FROM %5$s ORDER BY %1$s, %2$s, %3$s, %4$s", TB_PRIORITY, TB_COUNTRYCODE, TB_AREACODE, TB_NUMBER, listname);
00276 
00277         rc = sqlite3_prepare_v2(db, stmt, sizeof(stmt), &pp_stmt, p_tail);
00278 
00279         if ( rc != SQLITE_OK ) {
00280                 syslog(LOG_ERR, "[%s] SQL error: %s", COMPONENT_NAME, sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00281                 sqlite3_close(db);
00282                 return -1;
00283         }
00284 
00285         while ( rc != SQLITE_DONE ) {
00286                 rc = sqlite3_step(pp_stmt);
00287                 if ( SQLITE_ROW == rc ) {
00288                         found_flag = evaluate_stmt_string(pp_stmt, number, priority);
00289                         if ( found_flag == 1) {
00290                                 switch (listflag) {
00291                                         case WHITELIST_FLAG:
00292                                                 syslog(LOG_DEBUG, "[%s] Number \"%s\" accepted successfully.", COMPONENT_NAME, number);
00293                                                 break;
00294                                         case BLACKLIST_FLAG:
00295                                                 syslog(LOG_DEBUG, "[%s] Number \"%s\" blocked successfully.", COMPONENT_NAME, number);
00296                                                 break;
00297                                         default:
00298                                                 syslog(LOG_CRIT, "[%s] Stuff is no blacklist nor a whitelist.", COMPONENT_NAME);
00299                                 }
00300                                 break;
00301                         }
00302                 }
00303         }
00304 
00305 
00306         // Cleaning up
00307         sqlite3_finalize(pp_stmt);
00308         sqlite3_close(db);
00309 
00310         return found_flag;
00311 }

00313 int change_name(int country_code,
00314                 int area_code,
00315                 unsigned long long number,
00316                 char *new_name,
00317                 int listflag)
00318 {
00319         char *listname = (WHITELIST_FLAG == listflag) ? "whitelist" : "blacklist";
00320 
00321         sqlite3 *db;
00322         char stmt[STMT_SIZE];       // The SQL statement as text string.
00323         char *errMsg = 0;
00324         int rc;
00325 
00326         rc = sqlite3_open(DB_FILE, &db);
00327 
00328         if ( rc ) {
00329                 syslog(LOG_ERR, "[%s] Can't open database: %s", COMPONENT_NAME, sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00330                 sqlite3_close(db);
00331                 return 0;
00332         }
00333 
00334         sprintf(stmt, "UPDATE %s SET %s = \"%s\" WHERE %s = %d AND %s = %d AND %s = %lld", listname, TB_NAME, new_name, TB_COUNTRYCODE, country_code, TB_AREACODE, area_code, TB_NUMBER, number);
00335 
00336         rc = sqlite3_exec(db, stmt, NULL, 0, &errMsg);
00337         if ( SQLITE_OK != rc ) {
00338                 syslog(LOG_ERR, "[%s] SQL error: %s", COMPONENT_NAME, sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00339                 sqlite3_close(db);
00340                 return 0;
00341         }
00342 
00343         sqlite3_close(db);
00344 
00345         return 1;
00346 }

00360         char *errMsg = 0;

00363         rc = sqlite3_open(DB_FILE, &db);
00364 
00365         if ( rc ) {
00366                 syslog(LOG_ERR, "[%s] Can't open database: %s", COMPONENT_NAME, sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00367                 sqlite3_close(db);
00368                 return 0;
00369         }
00370 
00371         sprintf(stmt, "UPDATE %s SET %s = %d AND %s = %d AND %s = %lld WHERE %s = %d AND %s = %d AND %s = %lld", listname, TB_COUNTRYCODE, new_country_code, TB_AREACODE, new_area_code, TB_NUMBER, new_number, TB_COUNTRYCODE, country_code, TB_AREACODE, area_code, TB_NUMBER, number);
00372 
00373         rc = sqlite3_exec(db, stmt, NULL, 0, &errMsg);
00374         if ( SQLITE_OK != rc ) {
00375                 syslog(LOG_ERR, "[%s] SQL error: %s", COMPONENT_NAME, sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00376                 sqlite3_close(db);
00377                 return 0;
00378         }
00379 
00380         sqlite3_close(db);
00381 
00382         return 1;
00383 }

00420 int change_priority(int country_code,
